pages.text: Psittacosaurus sp. (SMF R 4970) comes from the Early Cretaceous, with fossils being found in the Yixian Formation, China. It is a small psittacosauriid, growing up to 1 m in length. It is the most well preserved and well known specimen, from bristle-like structures on the tail, finely preserved scales, integument and dermis,

right down to the colouration of the skin, and even the first known belly button from a non-avian dinosaur. Despite this, it has yet to be described to any of the 12 known species of Psittacosaurus, although P. mongoliensis has been ruled out as a possibility, based on hip features.
